Instructions:
Prepare the Pork Roast:

Preheat your oven to 350째F (175째C).
Season the pork roast generously with salt and pepper.
In a large oven-safe skillet or Dutch oven, heat the olive oil over medium-high heat. Sear the pork roast on all sides until it is browned, about 3-4 minutes per side. Remove the pork roast from the skillet and set aside.
Prepare the Vegetables:

In the same skillet, add the potatoes, onions, celery, and garlic. Cook for about 5 minutes, stirring occasionally, until the vegetables start to soften.
Season the vegetables with thyme, rosemary, salt, and pepper.
Deglaze and Roast:

Pour the chicken broth and white wine (if using) into the skillet to deglaze, scraping up any browned bits from the bottom of the pan.
Stir in the Dijon mustard.
Return the pork roast to the skillet, placing it on top of the vegetables.
Roast in the Oven:

Transfer the skillet to the preheated oven.
Roast for 1.5 to 2 hours, or until the internal temperature of the pork reaches 145째F (63째C) and the vegetables are tender.
Rest and Serve:

Remove the skillet from the oven and let the pork roast rest for 10 minutes before slicing.
Garnish with fresh parsley if desired.
Serve the sliced pork roast with the roasted vegetables.
